posts.content:
I just discovered Discord usernames were case sensitive (which I think it's really dumb). I guess I'm part of the "users don't know their usernames" group üòÇ

Also, I guess they should've allowed # in the usernames, so people could still be `something#1234` üòÇ

I thought it was cool that iPhones now have a dedicated Journal app. Yes, you can do things on the Notes app, and yes, you can use Obsidian, Notion, etc.

But it's another option, and one that is already included and ppl don't need to pay extra for it. Also it's native to Apple's ecosystem, which is good for people that are already on a Mac+iPad+iPhone.
Started watching Fubar today. 3 episodes in and having fun so far!

Was scrolling on Netflix and saw that I stopped watching The Uncanny Counter quite some time ago. I want to get back to it - also watch some other newer shows like All of Us Are Dead.

But it does seem like Koreans can't for the life of them write a school drama without bullying as a major plot point - or at least a very exaggerated bullying as an important secondary plot point. And many times of course will involve a Chaebol too.
TFW you discover that Jira Issues can't have checkboxes in the description... WTF?

Besides Harry Potter, which other book or series you love but can't really recommend anymore because of the author?

Mine is The Grimnoir Chronicles Series by Larry Correia. Loved the world building and action, and the magic system is easily one of my favorites, and I haven't found something similar and as good yet.

The detail about Faye's power is also really nice!
Yesterday I bought ele Sserafim‚Äôs Unforgiven album (dewy sage version). I just loved the photobook and the poster!

posts.content:
After quite a few years, I got back to watching Signal - watched the first episode about 5 or 6 years ago, but ended up not continuing.

4 episodes in and I'm really enjoying it!

Sad how the girl the detective liked died though, and how he didn't even learn about how the serial killer was caught :/

Got LingoDeer lifetime subscription (with Plus), as it was on sale until today, and seems to be what folks generally agree about on Reddit (/r/korean).

I went though the alphabet these last couple days, so today got the subscription and started the lessons after the alphabet. So far enjoying it!

Decided to drop learning German, and start with Korean.

Already wanted to learn it so long ago, and I think it's going to be more useful in the shorter/medium term.

Also, harder for me to integrate German in my day-to-day, since there's not a lot of shows/comics/news/etc that I could keep in touch with the culture. While for Korean, I do enjoy the dramas, kpop, and follow some idols on Instagram, etc, and am more interested in food/general culture

Watching Yellowjackets this season feels more of a chore than enjoyment and something exciting, as it was on season 1.

I‚Äôm glad From is releasing now, so at least I have something great to watch with my wife. And this week we should start Silo!
Watching Doctor Cha at the hotel but not understanding anything bc no English subtitles üòÇ
Ok, so Netflix cancelled Lockwood & Co‚Ä¶ Really, I‚Äôm not starting any new show from them. I refuse!

posts.content: Another Sunday, another great From episode on Paramount+

Quick (maybe dumb?) question about chargers/plug adapters:

I'm in Canada (120v), going to S. Korea (220v), looked into plug adapters, and found some that have both the Canadian plug + USB and USB-C

Now... if I were to plug phone, camera and powerbank to the USB, USB-C ports directly, would that work and not fry anything?

Or should I plug the Apple charger in the adapter, and then the usb cable to Apple's charger? ü§î

images.alt: Image showing plug adapter for South Korean outlet, with Canada and USB/USB-C outputs

Slow blogging: The anti-hustle method of writing for the web
https://www.elizabethtai.com/blog/slow-blogging-guide

I randomly remembered TV photo recaps. Those were so fun, and I wish there was some folks doing it nowadays for shows I'm watching.

I'm aware some folks do 'text posts' on Tumblr, but although it's a bit similar, it's way harder to find and navigate than having a blog covering a show (or more) and doing a post for each episode.

Penny dreadful example: https://ozgeburcaka.wordpress.com/2015/06/28/penny-dreadful-evil-spirits-in-heavenly-places-photo-recap/

Outlander example: https://ozgeburcaka.wordpress.com/2021/07/27/outlander-by-the-pricking-of-my-thumbs-recap/

posts.content:
No, Substack Notes is no Twitter or Mastodon killer/replacement.

It is interesting for those who are on Substack - even if just as subscribers - but it doesn't work like regular social media. The default experience is still following newsletters, and then being able to see author's notes on a separate tab. The big value here is those authors being able to share shorter content.
Halfway through season 2 of Evil, loving it still. Also nice to see Kristen Connolly here. She was in Zoo, which was a fun show that was getting way weirder each season, and I still liked it

Today‚Äôs Yellowjackets episode was kinda weak and didn‚Äôt keep my that much invested. But I think it might be setting up interesting things for the rest of the season, so I‚Äôll give it that

I think the present storyline was more interesting when the 4 of them were kinda together. Shauna and Tai‚Äôs plots now are a bit weird. Nat‚Äôs not that entertaining, but it‚Äôs teaching us a bit more about Lottie. Misty‚Äôs a bit fun

The past storyline continues to be interesting
Just finished season 1 of Evil on Paramount+. Watched it all in like 3~4 days, and I‚Äôm just starting season 2.

Photography quote stolen from Youtube:

‚ÄúIf people are noticing your corners aren‚Äôt sharp then anything you focused on in the center is not interesting‚Äù

Months later, and Warrior Nun is still trending for me on Twitter, and they are still going strong on their campaign to save the show.

This does make me think that it's not about it not being a profitable show - considering the audience, and that's not a very expensive show.

Seeing the new The Chosen One announcement, I guess they just wanted to make room for that somehow?
